    • Tail index inference

Compute (tail)-index

Source: R/tail_index.R
hillestimator.Rd

This function computes Hill (tail)-index estimate of a stationary time series.

hillestimator(path, k0 = NULL, plot = F)

Arguments

path

(vector of univariate observations)

k0

(vector of order statistics to compute Hill estimates). It uses k0 = n*0.05 otherwise

plot

(T or F if a plot should be shown).

Value

A data.frame of hill estimates as a function of k.

Examples

hillestimator(rainfall$LANVEOC[rainfall$SEASON=='SPRING'], 1:200)
#>       k Hill.estimate
#> 1     1     0.0000000
#> 2     2     0.3062167
#> 3     3     0.3842201
